import sys

def main():
    n = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    times = sorted([int(x) for x in sys.stdin.readline().split()])

    a = 0
    b = 0
    for i in range(n):
        if i % 2 == 0:
            a += times[i]
        else:
            b += times[i]

    print(max(a, b))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

N = int(input())
times = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Sort the times in descending order
times.sort(reverse=True)

# Greedy algorithm
# The one with the shortest time should go first
# The second shortest time should go second, etc.
# The longest time should go last (this is the only time it will be waiting, so it doesn't matter)

# The time it takes to finish all lectures is the sum of the times
print(sum(times))

def main():
    n = int(input())
    times = [int(x) for x in input().split()]

    times.sort()

    total = 0
    for i in range(n):
        total += (n - i) * times[i]

    print(total)


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

# Solution

# Number of teams.
N = int(input())
# Time required for the i-th team to understand and implement an algorithm.
T = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Sorted times.
T.sort()

total_time = 0

# When the number of teams is even.
if N % 2 == 0:
    for i in range(0, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]
    for i in range(1, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]

# When the number of teams is odd.
else:
    for i in range(1, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]
    for i in range(0, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]

print(total_time)

import sys

def main():
    n = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    times = [int(x) for x in sys.stdin.readline().split()]

    times.sort()

    total = 0
    for i in range(n):
        total += (n - i) * times[i]

    sys.stdout.write(str(total) + "\n")


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

import sys

def main():
    n = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    times = [int(x) for x in sys.stdin.readline().split()] * 2
    times.sort()

    a = 0
    b = 0
    for i in range(n * 2):
        if i < n:
            if i % 2 == 0:
                a += times[i]
            else:
                b += times[i]
        elif i > n:
            if i % 2 == 0:
                b += times[i]
            else:
                a += times[i]

    print(max(a, b))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()


N = int(input())
times = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Sort the times in ascending order
times.sort()

# Greedy algorithm
# The one with the longest time should go first
# The second longest time should go second, etc.
# The shortest time should go last (this is the only time it will be waiting, so it doesn't matter)

# The time it takes to finish all lectures is the sum of the times
print(sum(times[i] * (N - i) for i in range(N)))

import sys

def main():
    n = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    times = [int(x) for x in sys.stdin.readline().split()]
    times.sort()

    a = 0
    b = 0
    for i in range(n):
        if i % 2 == 0:
            a += times[i]
        else:
            b += times[i]

    print(max(a, b)) 

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

# Solution

# Number of teams
N = int(input())
# Time required for the i-th team to understand and implement the algorithm
T = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Sorted times
T.sort()

total_time = 0

# When the number of teams is even
if N % 2 == 0:
    for i in range(0, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]
    for i in range(1, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]

# When the number of teams is odd
else:
    for i in range(1, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]
    for i in range(0, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]

print(total_time)

N = int(input())
times = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Greedy algorithm
# The one with the shortest time should go first
# The second shortest time should go second, etc.
# and the longest time should go last (this is the only time it will be waiting, so it doesn't matter)
# Sort the times in descending order
times.sort(reverse=True)


# The time it takes to finish all lectures is the sum of the times
print(sum(times))


N = int(input())
times = list(map(int, input().split()))
times.sort()

totalTime = 0

for i in range(N):
    totalTime += sum(times[i:])

print(totalTime)
import sys


input = sys.stdin.readline

N = int(input())  # 입력받은 사람의 수
times = list(map(int, input().split()))  # 각 사람이 끝내는데 걸리는 시간

times.sort()  # 시간 순으로 정렬

totalTime = 0  # 총 대기 시간

for i in range(N):
    totalTime += sum(times[i:])  # 각 사람마다 남은 사람들의 시간을 더해줌

print(totalTime)

N = int(input())
times = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Sort the times in descending order
times.sort(reverse=True)

# Greedy algorithm
# The one with the shortest time should go first
# The second shortest time should go second, etc.
# And the longest time should go last (this is the only time it will be waiting, so it doesn't matter)

# The time it takes to finish all lectures is the sum of the times
print(sum(times))

N = int(input())
times = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Sort the times in descending order
times.sort(reverse=True)

# Greedy algorithm
# The one with the shortest time should go first
# The second shortest time should go second, etc.
# And the longest time should go last (this is the only time it will be waiting, so it doesn't matter)

# The time it takes to finish all lectures is the sum of the times
print(sum(times))

n = int(input())
teams = [int(x) for x in input().split()]
teams = sorted(teams)

total_time = 0

for i in range(n):
    total_time += teams[i] * (n - i)

print(total_time)

# Number of teams
N = int(input())
# Time required for the i-th team to understand and implement an algorithm
T = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Sorted times
T.sort()

total_time = 0

# When the number of teams is even
if N % 2 == 0:
    for i in range(0, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]
    for i in range(1, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]

# When the number of teams is odd
else:
    for i in range(1, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]
    for i in range(0, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]

print(total_time)

def main():
    print("Hello")


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

teams.sort()

print(sum(teams[0::2]) + sum(teams[1::2]))
import sys

def main():
    n = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    times = [int(x) for x in sys.stdin.readline().split()]
    times.sort()

    a = 0
    b = 0
    for i in range(n):
        if i % 2 == 0:
            a += times[i]
        else:
            b += times[i]

    print(max(a, b))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

#!/usr/bin/python3
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

# Number of teams
N = int(input())
# Time required for the i-th team to understand and implement the algorithm
T = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Sorted times
T.sort()

total_time = 0
for i in range(N):
    total_time += T[i] * (N - i)

print(total_time)
# Accepted

N = int(input())
times = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Sort the times in descending order
times.sort(reverse=True)

# Greedy algorithm
# The one with the shortest time should go first
# The second shortest time should go second, etc.
# and the longest time should go last (this is the only time it will be waiting, so it doesn't matter)

# The time it takes to finish all lectures is the sum of the times
print(sum(times))
